normalised: Energy and Utilities: Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace

unnormalised: New Delhi, 26/10/2023 – The nationwide Smart Meter National Programme (SMNP) is gaining momentum, with significant installations reported across several states. Power distribution companies (DISCOMs), including those in Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra, are accelerating the deployment of smart meters to enhance billing efficiency and reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: New Delhi, twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty three – The nationwide Smart Meter National Programme (S M N P) is gaining momentum, with significant installations reported across several states. Power distribution companies (D I S C O M s), including those in Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra, are accelerating the deployment of smart meters to enhance billing efficiency and reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses.

unnormalised: The initiative aims to replace conventional meters with smart meters, enabling real-time data collection and improved grid management. As per Ministry of Power sources, over 5 million smart meters have already been installed as of 15/09/2023, with plans to reach 250 million by December 2025. This will allow consumers to better manage their energy consumption, potentially reducing their monthly electricity bills. For instance, Mrs. Sharma from Lucknow notes she can now monitor her daily consumption via the DISCOM app.

unnormalised: However, challenges remain, including concerns about data privacy and ensuring interoperability between different meter manufacturers. A stakeholders' meeting is scheduled for 02/11/2023 at 10:00 hrs in Hyderabad to address these issues and streamline the rollout process. The ultimate goal is to empower consumers and create a more sustainable and efficient power sector, benefiting both the DISCOMs and end-users like Mrs. Iyer in Chennai.
